IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO ACCOMPLISH ITS MISSION, THE HUNTER COLLEGE FOUNDATION ENGAGES IN THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:- ACTIVELY PROMOTES HUNTER COLLEGE, INCLUDING ALL OF ITS SCHOOLS, PROGRAMS, CENTERS, AND CAMPUSES- CULTIVATES RELATIONSHIPS THAT LEAD TO FUNDING- ENGAGES CURRENT AND POTENTIAL DONORS IN THE LIFE OF THE COLLEGE- MANAGES INVESTMENTS JUDICIOUSLY- ENSURES THAT RESTRICTED FUNDS ARE UTILIZED FOR DONOR-RESTRICTED PURPOSESAREAS OF SUPPORT INCLUDE:- FACULTY RECRUITMENT, DEVELOPMENT, AND RETENTION- ACCESS FOR QUALIFIED STUDENTS, INCLUDING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS- STUDENT SUPPORT SERVICES- PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT- MATERIAL, TECHNOLOGY, AND EQUIPMENT- FACILITY DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE HUNTER COLLEGE FOUNDATION IS TO ENHANCE HUNTERCOLLEGE'S POSITION AS A PREMIERE PUBLIC EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION. HUNTER COLLEGE IS COMPRISED OF THE SCHOOL OF THE ARTS & SCIENCES, SCHOOL OF EDUCATION, SCHOOL OF SOCIAL WORK, SCHOOL OF URBAN PUBLIC HEALTH, HUNTER COLLEGE SCHOOL OF NURSING, HUNTER COLLEGE HIGH SCHOOL, AND HUNTER COLLEGE ELEMENTARY SCHOOL.THE HUNTER COLLEGE FOUNDATION BOARD CONSISTS OF A SELECT NUMBER OF OUTSTANDING ALUMNI AND DISTINGUISHED COMMUNITY AND BUSINESS LEADERS WHO ARE COMMITTED TO HELP RAISE THE COLLEGE'S PUBLIC IMAGE AND RAISE FUNDS TO FURTHER STRENGTHEN THE INSTITUTION.
IRS990.Desc: FACILITY RENOVATIONS:THE HUNTER COLLEGE FOUNDATION SUPPORTS THE REPAIRS, RENOVATION AND IMPROVEMENTS OF THE FACILITIES AT HUNTER COLLEGE SUCH AS RENOVATION OF THE LIBRARY, UPGRADES TO CLASSROOMS AND LABORATORIES AND PURCHASE OF STATE OF THE ART EQUIPMENT. THIS SUPPORTS THE COLLEGE IN ITS ENDEAVOR TO OFFER ITS STUDENTS THE BEST FACILITIES AND LEARNING ENVIRONMENT.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS: THE FOUNDATION PROVIDES SUPPORT TO ACADEMIC PROGRAMS TO HELP ADVANCE EDUCATIONAL EXCELLENCE AND FURTHER CURRICULUM AND FACULTY DEVELOPMENT. THE FOUNDATION ALSO HELPS TO SUPPORT AND CREATE NEW PROGRAMS AND DEPARTMENTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS: THE HUNTER COLLEGE FOUNDATION DISTRIBUTES A VARIETY OF SCHOLARSHIPS TO DESERVING STUDENTS BASED ON CRITERIA SUCH AS MERIT, NEED, GRADE POINT AVERAGE AND DECLARATION OF A MAJOR COURSE OF STUDY. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS PLAY AN IMPORTANT ROLE IN EDUCATING THE NEXT GENERATION OF CITIZENS AND PERPETUATING THE EXTRAORDINARY HUNTER COMMUNITY OF SCHOLARS, STUDENTS AND ALUMNI. APPROXIMATELY 1,780 STUDENTS RECEIVED SCHOLARSHIPS THROUGH THE HUNTER COLLEGE FOUNDATION IN THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30,2022.DUE TO EXTRAORDINARY PANDEMIC CIRCUMSTANCES AT THE END OF FISCAL YEAR 2021-22, HUNTER COLLEGE FOUNDATION DISTRIBUTED 655 EMERGENCY STIPENDS (APPROXIMATELY $293,662) AND TECHNOLOGY TO STUDENTS IN NEED IN FISCAL YEAR 2021-22.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MISSION OF THE HUNTER COLLEGE FOUNDATION IS TO ENHANCE HUNTER COLLEGE'S POSITION AS A PREMIERE PUBLIC EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION. THE FOUNDATION'S ENDOWMENT SUPPORTS THE FOLLOWING AREAS: - FACULTY RECRUITMENT, DEVELOPMENT, AND RETENTION - ACCESS FOR QUALIFIED STUDENTS, INCLUDING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS - STUDENT SUPPORT SERVICES - PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT - MATERIALS, TECHNOLOGY, AND EQUIPMENT - FACILITY DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE

THE FOUNDATION IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE; THEREFORE, NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES IS REFLECTED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE FOUNDATION HAS BEEN CLASSIFIED AS A PUBLICLY SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION THAT IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION UNDER SECTION 509(A) OF THE CODE. THE FOUNDATION PRESENTLY DISCLOSES OR RECOGNIZES INCOME TAX POSITIONS BASED ON MANAGEMENT'S ESTIMATE OF WHETHER IT IS REASONABLY POSSIBLE OR PROBABLE THAT A LIABILITY HAS BEEN INCURRED FOR UNRECOGNIZED INCOME TAXES. MANAGEMENT HAS CONCLUDED THAT THE FOUNDATION HAS TAKEN NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRE ADJUSTMENT IN IT FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. U.S. FORMS 990 FILED BY THE FOUNDATION ARE SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES.
NET REVENUE & EXPENSES OF RELATED ORGANIZATION 19,281.

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: CENTRAL AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN - ANTIGUA & BARBUDA, ARUBA, BAHAMAS,

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS NOT REQUIRED TO FILE FORM 926 BECAUSE IT MEETS THE APPLICABLE FILING THRESHOLD REQUIREMENT. THE ORGANIZATION IS NOT REQUIRED TO FILE FORM 5471 BECAUSE IT DOES NOT MEET THE APPLICABLE THRESHOLD OWNERSHIP OR OTHER FILING REQUIREMENTS.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: HUNTER COLLEGE OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: TO SUPPORT HUNTER COLLEGE TOWARDS SALARIES, SCHOLARSHIPS, EQUIPMENT, PROGRAM, CAMPUS SCHOOL

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: RESEARCH FOUNDATION OF CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK
CUNY CENTRAL OFFICE- OFFICE OF UNIVERSITY CONTROLLER

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: CUNY CENTRAL OFFICE DISTRIBUTES THE SCHOLARSHIPS TO HUNTER STUDENTS ON BEHALF OF HUNTER COLLEGE

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS: THE HUNTER COLLEGE FOUNDATION (HCF) SUPPORTS THE ACTIVITIES OF THE SPECIFIC ORGANIZATIONS BY PROVIDING GRANTS TO THEM. HCF SYSTEMATICALLY REQUIRES COPIES OF THE RECEIPTS AND INVOICES, BUDGET AND PROJECT PROGRESS INFORMATION FROM THESE ORGANIZATIONS TO ASSURE PROPER USAGE OF THE FUNDS. THE PURPOSE OF THE EXPENDITURES IS COMPARED TO THE PURPOSE OF THE RESPECTIVE ACCOUNT. GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS: THE FOUNDATION TRANSFERS THE FUNDS TO THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK (CUNY) CENTRAL OFFICE WHO APPLIES THEM AGAINTS STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS (TOWARDS THEIR TUITIONS). ANY BALANCES ARE REFUNDED DIRECTLY TO STUDENTS BY CUNY CHECK. SOME DONORS DO REQUIRE STEWARDSHIP REPORTS, DETAILING HOW THE FOUNDATION ALLOCATED THE FUNDS AND HOW THE STUDENTS WERE SELECTED. THE FOUNDATION HAS PROCESSES IN PLACE TO ENABLE IT TO PREPARE SUCH STEWARDSHIP REPORTS WHEN THEY ARE REQUIRED.

HUNTER COLLEGE IS PART OF THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK ("CUNY"), A QUASI-GOVERNMENTAL ENTITY, AND THEREFORE FOLLOWS CUNY'S HIRING PRACTICES. THIS POSITION IS IN THE CUNY EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION PLAN ("ECP"). THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF CUNY ESTABLISHES COMPENSATION RANGES FOR ECP EMPLOYEES BASED ON THE LEVEL OF RESPONSIBILITY AND REVIEWS AND APPROVES ALL ECP APPOINTMENTS TO ENSURE COMPARABILITY ACROSS THE CUNY SYSTEM WHICH CONSISTS OF TWENTY-FIVE COLLEGES AND SCHOOLS.
BASED ON NUMBER OF DONORS; SOME DONATIONS OF MULTIPLE SECURITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES REVIEWS THE FORM 990 WITH MANAGEMENT AND AUDITORS AND APPROVES THE FORM 990 FOR FILING. FOLLOWING AUDIT COMMITTEE APPROVAL AND PRIOR TO FILING, A COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS ELECTRONICALLY DELIVERED TO EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST AND DISCLOSURE POLICY IS DISTRIBUTED TO BOARD MEMBERS AT THE INITIAL MEETING OF THE YEAR. THE BOARD MEMBERS REVIEW THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST AND DISCLOSURE POLICY, SIGN THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST AND DISCLOSURE POLICY ANNUAL STATEMENT AND RETURN THE FORMS TO THE FOUNDATION. THESE FORMS ARE THEN REVIEWED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE. THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY COVERS ANY INTERESTED PERSON WHO IS A TRUSTEE, OFFICER, KEY EMPLOYEE OR MEMBER OF A COMMITTEE WITH POWERS DELEGATED BY THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD. AN INTERESTED PERSON WILL DISCLOSE ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND TO THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE CONSIDERING THE PROPOSED TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE WILL DETERMINE WHETHER A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS. AFTER THE INTERESTED PERSON DISCLOSES THE POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST AND ALL MATERIAL FACTS, THE INTERESTED PERSON SHALL LEAVE THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEETING AND THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEMBERS SHALL DECIDE AND VOTE ON WHETHER A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS. IF THERE IS A POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST, AN INTERESTED PERSON MAY MAKE A PRESENTATION AT THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE MEETING BUT WILL THEN LEAVE THE MEETING BEFORE THE DISCUSSION AND VOTE ON THE TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT INVOLVING THE POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST. THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE WILL, IF APPROPRIATE, APPOINT A DISINTERESTED PERSON OR COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE ALTERNATIVES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 990 IS AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION AS REQUIRED UNDER SECTION 6104 OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. IT IS POSTED ON GUIDESTAR.ORG AND OTHER SIMILAR TYPES OF WEBSITES. IN ADDITION, ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION, BY-LAWS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE ALSO AVAILABLE UPON WRITTEN REQUEST OR BY CALLING THE ORGANIZATION DIRECTLY.

FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND REPORTING: THE ORGANIZATION HAS A COMMITTEE THAT ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT AND ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT. THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: RENOVATING, IMPROVING, CONSTRUCTING, EXPANDING & ENHANCING HUNTER COLLEGE
